Package ePortfolio

Class Portfolio

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Portfolio
public class Portfolio extends Object
The Portfolio class manages a collection of investments, including stocks and mutual funds. It provides methods to buy, sell, update investments, calculate total gains, and search for investments based on criteria like symbol, keywords, and price range.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Portfolio()
    Constructs a new, empty Portfolio object.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    buy(Scanner scanner)
    Buys an investment by adding to the existing quantity if already owned, or creating a new investment if not owned.
    void
    getGain()
    Calculates and displays the gain for each investment individually, as well as the total portfolio gain.
    ArrayList<Investment>
    getInvestments()
    Returns the list of investments in the portfolio.
    void
    search(Scanner scanner)
    Searches for investments based on a symbol, keywords in the name, and a price range.
    void
    sell(Scanner scanner)
    Sells a specified quantity of an investment, updating its quantity or removing it if sold completely.
    void
    setInvestments(ArrayList<Investment> investments)
    Sets the list of investments in the portfolio.
    void
    update(Scanner scanner)
    Updates the price of each investment in the portfolio by prompting the user for new values, validating that the input price is non-negative.
    void
    updateKeywordIndex()
    Updates the keyword index for investment names, mapping each unique keyword to the list of indexes where it appears within the portfolio.

  • Constructor Details

    • Portfolio

      public Portfolio()
      Constructs a new, empty Portfolio object.

  • Method Details

    • buy

      public void buy(Scanner scanner)
      Buys an investment by adding to the existing quantity if already owned, or creating a new investment if not owned. Prompts the user to input details such as type, symbol, quantity, and price.
      Parameters:
      scanner - the Scanner object to read user input

    • sell

      public void sell(Scanner scanner)
      Sells a specified quantity of an investment, updating its quantity or removing it if sold completely. The user specifies the symbol, quantity, and price, with validation of input values.
      Parameters:
      scanner - the Scanner object to read user input

    • update

      public void update(Scanner scanner)
      Updates the price of each investment in the portfolio by prompting the user for new values, validating that the input price is non-negative.
      Parameters:
      scanner - the Scanner object to read user input

    • getGain

      public void getGain()
      Calculates and displays the gain for each investment individually, as well as the total portfolio gain.

    • search

      public void search(Scanner scanner)
      Searches for investments based on a symbol, keywords in the name, and a price range. Displays matching investments if found, or a message if no matches are found.
      Parameters:
      scanner - the Scanner object to read user input

    • updateKeywordIndex

      public void updateKeywordIndex()
      Updates the keyword index for investment names, mapping each unique keyword to the list of indexes where it appears within the portfolio. This facilitates faster searching by keywords.

    • getInvestments

      public ArrayList<Investment> getInvestments()
      Returns the list of investments in the portfolio.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Investment objects

    • setInvestments

      public void setInvestments(ArrayList<Investment> investments)
      Sets the list of investments in the portfolio.
      Parameters:
      investments - the ArrayList of investments to set in the portfolio
